title: What does the new testament say about death? - Quora

response.answer_text: Here’s how you find out: go to www.biblegateway.comIn the drop-down menu, select a translation you like. If you don’t know, then “New International Version (NIV)” is good. If you prefer a different language, scroll down and you might find it there.In the left window, where it says Enter keyword, passage, or topic type death. Hit “enter”This will find you all mentions of the word “death” in the entire Bible. But in the grey bit immediately to the right of the verses, you’ll see a “filter by” option.In the “filter by” menu, click New Testament.Here’s the shortcut that does that for you: BibleGateway - : death That’s all the mentions of the word “death” in the NIV translation of the New Testament. It just shows each “verse” that contains that word. In case you’re not at all familiar with the Bible, a verse is about the length of a sentence, although it’s often just part of a sentence. When the Bible was written, it wasn’t divided into chapters or verses, but they were put in by translators to make it easier to read and so that before the Internet people could give an “address” for any part of the Bible they wanted. If a verse looks interesting to you, click “in context” or “full chapter” underneath it. For what it’s worth, I’m an atheist and I don’t think the Bible is a great place to learn anything interesting about death.
